related_issues.title: Pieces OS Does not recognize folders or files
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS Does not recognize folders or files
### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS 11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

So until about a weekish ago, Everything would work smoothly, except for some other issues that did annoy me, but I had workarounds for them. Those issues was pieces os not working after a while. Not a big deal since I would just close it in task manager and reopen it once it was all closed to force a hard restart of the whole system. But, now (thanks for listening to my little rant up there) there is an issue that I cannot workaround. For some reason pieces cannot get any context from any files or folders, and its getting pretty annoying to the fact that I have started using other softwares because at least they can look at the files and suggest changes or edits that actually have something to do with my code. I believe this happened ever since i updated pieces os about 2-3 updates ago, but cannot pinpoint any specific cause. Another cause may be that fact that I downloaded Ollama but never really used it.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* RamanBaig is experiencing difficulty with Pieces not reading files, even though it recognizes their existence.
* This issue persists even when copying and pasting the code into the chat.
* The issue occurs with both Claude and GPT models, and across various folders and files.
* RamanBaig is using Windows 11 Home, 24H2, and has Long Term Memory enabled.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces is unable to read file contents directly, requiring manual copy-paste.
* This issue is particularly problematic for large files with thousands of lines of code.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Sam-at-pieces suggests collecting additional information, including Windows version, file count, and related files displayed.
* They also propose scheduling a call to discuss the issue in detail and potentially reproduce it.
* Sam-at-pieces mentions recent changes that might address the issue and suggests testing them with Mark-at-pieces.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* RamanBaig is available to schedule a call after 3 pm EST.
* Sam-at-pieces suggests a call with Mark-at-pieces to further investigate and test potential solutions.

**Additional Notes:**

* The exact cause of the problem remains unidentified.
* A resolution is pending further investigation and testing.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS connection issues in remote environments
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS from remote environments like Docker containers and the Windsurf platform. This is often due to outdated plugin versions, changes in default listening ports, and network configuration issues. related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: **Key Points Raised:** - User `malanciault` encountered an issue where they couldn't connect to Pieces OS from a remote DevContainer within VSCode. - The default listening port for Pieces Server had changed, leading to connection problems. - This was due to security changes implemented in Pieces OS version 11.0.0 and above. **Identified Problems:** - The documentation for connecting to Pieces OS was outdated. - The Pieces server was only listening on the loopback interface. - This caused compatibility issues with remote DevContainer connections. **Proposed/Implemented Solutions:** - Patching the VSCode extension to allow listening on all interfaces. - Allowing users to set a custom URL for connecting to Pieces OS. **Current Status/Outcome:** - Patch has been implemented and released in version 2.0.1 of the VSCode extension. - User `malanciault` reported the issue wasn't resolved with the new extension version. - A video call was offered to further troubleshoot the problem. **Next Steps:** - Investigate and address the issue why the patching didn't resolve the problem for `malanciault`. - Provide further support and assistance to resolve the connection issues for the user. **Additional Notes:** - The user provided screenshots to visually represent their issue and findings. - The developer acknowledged the user's patience and collaboration in troubleshooting the problem.

related_issues.text: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors ### Software Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. It appears the browser extension is sniffing a bunch of local ports - starting with 1000. This is a bit concerning, and a little invasive, but I do have the Pieces OS running, and it does finally get a response at a high port. This fills my devtools console tab, degrading my development experience by clouding errors I'm looking for in my own app. For a product designed to enhance my development experience I'm marking this as a bug. ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: **Key Points Raised:** * The recent update to Pieces OS changed the designated port, making it difficult to determine its running status. * The tool logs network checks against inactive ports, causing clutter in the user's development console. * This constant logging is considered invasive and affects the user's debugging experience. **Problems Identified:** * Difficulty identifying the port on which Pieces OS is running. * Cluttered development console due to network checks for inactive ports. * Negative user experience due to the invasive network activity. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Implementing a fix in the upcoming patch update to hide or handle network errors gracefully. * Temporarily, users can hide network messages in the dev console settings. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue is confirmed to possibly be a Chrome bug with no definite fix in sight. * A temporary solution is provided, but it may not be suitable for all users. * The developers are exploring other solutions to address the problem effectively. **Additional Notes:** * The developers are committed to addressing the issue and improve the user experience. * The communication between the user and developer is professional and courteous.

common_issues.title: Long-Term Memory Feature Issues in Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties enabling and using the Long-Term Memory (LTM) feature in Pieces OS, particularly on Linux.  The issues include the LTM engine not activating, functionality not working as expected, and incompatibility with Wayland.  Proposed solutions and workarounds involve switching to X11, providing log files for debugging, and waiting for upcoming software updates and database migrations.

related_issues.title: Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
related_issues.text:
Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

### Description
I'm experiencing issues with the Long-Term Memory feature on Linux. While the Discord team has confirmed that this feature should be available on Linux, the Pieces OS interface explicitly shows that the feature is not available for Linux systems.

### Current Behavior
- Pieces OS shows a message indicating Long-Term Memory is not available for Linux
- Long-Term Memory functionality does not work on the Linux platform
- Other operating systems appear to have this feature working correctly

### Expected Behavior
- Long-Term Memory feature should be available and functional on Linux, as confirmed by the Discord team

### Evidence
- [Discord communication confirming feature availability](https://discord.com/channels/1098986658851999776/1320479548797882430/1320643614443048971)

- ![Screenshot showing Pieces OS message about feature unavailability on Linux](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ca6cb2d0-ef52-4194-bd57-c8a84be2d0db)



### Questions
1. When can Linux users expect this feature to be fully available?
2. Is there a planned timeline for Linux support?
3. Are there any workarounds available in the meantime?

### System Information
- Operating System: Linux [Zorin OS 17.2 based on Linux 6.8.0-50-generic~22.04.1-Ubuntu]
- Pieces OS Version: [PiecesOS 11.0.3]
- Desktop App: [Pieces for Developers 3.3.2]

### Additional Notes
This feature is currently working on other operating systems, and Linux users would greatly benefit from having access to this functionality.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Long-Term Memory Engine (LTM) on Linux

**Key Points Raised:**

* LTM is currently in a testing phase on Linux.
* It works on x11 but not Wayland.
* The `Discord Team` may have provided incorrect information about LTM availability.
* Switching to x11 may not guarantee LTM functionality.
* The feature may not be stable and may have issues working on some Linux distros.
* There are known issues with the LTM dependency booting up on some devices.

**Problems Identified:**

* LTM doesn't work on Wayland.
* The on button for LTM is not functional.
* Users are experiencing difficulties enabling LTM.
* LTM may not be fully stable or compatible with all Linux distros.
* A dependency needed for LTM is failing to boot on some devices.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Trying x11 instead of Wayland.
* Providing log files for troubleshooting.
* Scheduling a video call for live troubleshooting.
* Deprecating the failing dependency.
* Sharing updates on a related GitHub issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* LTM is still in a testing phase and not fully stable.
* The issue with the failing dependency is being investigated.
* The development team is actively working on solutions.
* Users are encouraged to provide feedback and logs to assist with troubleshooting.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users experiencing issues with LTM are encouraged to follow the linked GitHub issue for updates and participate in the discussion.
* The team is also requesting users to schedule a video call for live troubleshooting.

This summary provides a concise overview of the key points, problems, solutions, and current status of the LTM conversation on GitHub. It is important to note that the issue is still ongoing and the team is actively working on solutions.

related_issues.title: Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
related_issues.text:
Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

### Description
I'm experiencing issues with the Long-Term Memory feature on Linux. While the Discord team has confirmed that this feature should be available on Linux, the Pieces OS interface explicitly shows that the feature is not available for Linux systems.

### Current Behavior
- Pieces OS shows a message indicating Long-Term Memory is not available for Linux
- Long-Term Memory functionality does not work on the Linux platform
- Other operating systems appear to have this feature working correctly

### Expected Behavior
- Long-Term Memory feature should be available and functional on Linux, as confirmed by the Discord team

### Evidence
- [Discord communication confirming feature availability](https://discord.com/channels/1098986658851999776/1320479548797882430/1320643614443048971)

- ![Screenshot showing Pieces OS message about feature unavailability on Linux](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ca6cb2d0-ef52-4194-bd57-c8a84be2d0db)



### Questions
1. When can Linux users expect this feature to be fully available?
2. Is there a planned timeline for Linux support?
3. Are there any workarounds available in the meantime?

### System Information
- Operating System: Linux [Zorin OS 17.2 based on Linux 6.8.0-50-generic~22.04.1-Ubuntu]
- Pieces OS Version: [PiecesOS 11.0.3]
- Desktop App: [Pieces for Developers 3.3.2]

### Additional Notes
This feature is currently working on other operating systems, and Linux users would greatly benefit from having access to this functionality.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Long-Term Memory Engine (LTM) on Linux

**Key Points Raised:**

* LTM is currently in a testing phase on Linux.
* It works on x11 but not Wayland.
* The `Discord Team` may have provided incorrect information about LTM availability.
* Switching to x11 may not guarantee LTM functionality.
* The feature may not be stable and may have issues working on some Linux distros.
* There are known issues with the LTM dependency booting up on some devices.

**Problems Identified:**

* LTM doesn't work on Wayland.
* The on button for LTM is not functional.
* Users are experiencing difficulties enabling LTM.
* LTM may not be fully stable or compatible with all Linux distros.
* A dependency needed for LTM is failing to boot on some devices.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Trying x11 instead of Wayland.
* Providing log files for troubleshooting.
* Scheduling a video call for live troubleshooting.
* Deprecating the failing dependency.
* Sharing updates on a related GitHub issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* LTM is still in a testing phase and not fully stable.
* The issue with the failing dependency is being investigated.
* The development team is actively working on solutions.
* Users are encouraged to provide feedback and logs to assist with troubleshooting.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users experiencing issues with LTM are encouraged to follow the linked GitHub issue for updates and participate in the discussion.
* The team is also requesting users to schedule a video call for live troubleshooting.

This summary provides a concise overview of the key points, problems, solutions, and current status of the LTM conversation on GitHub. It is important to note that the issue is still ongoing and the team is actively working on solutions.

Obsidian Plugin
### Software

Desktop Application

Windows

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi! I'm attempting to get the Pieces for Devs Obsidian plugin to work. The installation of the Pieces for Devs " Pieces for Obsidian plugin" goes seemingly faultless as it reports in green: " Pieces for Obsidian plugin installed successfully". 

 However, as soon as I attempt to enable the plugin (v1.21.1)the following error pops up ”Failed to load plugin ‘pieces-for-developers’”. 
- Obsidian v1.7.7 is up to date, and running. 
- Pieces OS v11.0.3 is running, and 
- Pieces for Devs Desktop is up and running @ v3.3.3. 
- The OS is Windows 10 Pro 64 bit Version 22H2, Build 19045.5247 updated 02-02-2025

I have followed the guidelines in the following documentation (https://docs.pieces.app/extensions-plugins/obsidian). The install fails with a not-very-helpful answer. ”Failed to load plugin ‘pieces-for-developers’”

Referring to the section "https://docs.pieces.app/extensions-plugins/obsidian#having-trouble-with-the-pieces-for-developers-obsidian-plugin" in the documentation still fails to provide the expected results, so the next step would be to attempt to find related installation logs that might shed light on the issue.

I've searched for possible issues indicating this type of bug/issue but none were found here on GitHub.
I had a look at the `obsidian.log` file in the `C:\Users\[user]\AppData\Roaming\obsidian` folder but there's no indication at all nor any mention of any plugins or installations related to such.

Repeat uninstall/reinstall advice does not resolve the problem either.
Could you indicate which other Pieces, Obsidian and Win-OS logs would be the most appropriate to investigate which might shed light on the cause, please?

**Edit:**
I'm using other plugins without any issues.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/19b3dcd2-05fa-4171-ae2e-dc71b5ce451c)

Thank you for looking into this.
